member.name: T:Accord.Controls.ColorSlider
member.summary: Color slider control.

remarks.para: The control represent a color slider, which allows selecting one or two values in the [0, 255] range. The application of this control includes mostly areas of image processing and computer vision, where it is required to select color threshold or ranges for different type of color filtering.
Depending on the control's , it has different look and may suite different tasks. See documentation to for information about available type and possible control's looks.

member.name: E:Accord.Controls.ColorSlider.ValuesChanged
member.summary: An event, to notify about changes of or properties.

remarks.para: The event is fired after changes of or property, which is caused by user dragging the corresponding controlâ€™s arrow (slider).

member.name: T:Accord.Controls.ColorSlider.ColorSliderType
member.summary: Enumeration of color slider types.

remarks.para: The slider's type supposes the control's background filled with gradient startting from color and ending with color. The color does not have impact on control's look.
This type allows as one-arrow, as two-arrows control.
The slider's type supposes the control's background filled with gradient startting from color and ending with color. In addition the areas, which are outside of [, ] range, are filled with color.
This type allows only two-arrows control.
The slider's type supposes the control's background filled with gradient startting from color and ending with color. In addition the area, which is inside of [, ] range, is filled with color.
This type allows only two-arrows control.
The slider's type supposes filling areas outside of [, ] range with and inside the range with . The color does not have impact on control's look.
This type allows as one-arrow, as two-arrows control.

member.summary: Minimum selected value, [0, 255].

member.name: P:Accord.Controls.ColorSlider.Max
member.summary: Maximum selected value, [0, 255].

member.name: P:Accord.Controls.ColorSlider.DoubleArrow
member.summary: Single or Double arrow slider control.

remarks.para: The property specifies if the slider has one or two selection arrows (sliders).
The single arrow allows only to specify one value, which is set by property. The single arrow slider is useful for applications, where it is required to select color threshold, for example.
The double arrow allows to specify two values, which are set by and properties. The double arrow slider is useful for applications, where it is required to select filtering color range, for example.

member.name: T:Accord.Controls.ManipulatorControl
member.summary: Manipulator control.

remarks.para: The manipulator control can be used to mimic behaviour of analogue joystick using regular mouse. By dragging manipulator away from control's centre, it fires event notifying about its X/Y coordinates (or about R/Theta coordinates in Polar coordinates system).

For example, in robotics applications the control can be used to drive robots. If user drags manipulator further from centre (increasing distance between centre and manipulator), then higher power (speed) should be set for robot's motors. But dragging it in different directions away from centre should result in changing robot's direction: straight forward, backward, turning right or left, etc.

Another possible application of the control is to control position of some device, etc. For example, the control could be used with pan-tilt camera - by dragging control away from centre, the camera may rotate in one of the directions.

member.name: P:Accord.Controls.ManipulatorControl.IsSquareLook
member.summary: Determines if the control has square or round look.

remarks.para: The control has a square look if the property is set to , otherwise it has round look.
Default value is set to .

member.name: P:Accord.Controls.ManipulatorControl.DrawHorizontalAxis
member.summary: Determines if horizontal axis should be drawn or not.

remarks.para: Default value is set to .

member.name: P:Accord.Controls.ManipulatorControl.DrawVerticalAxis
member.summary: Determines if vertical axis should be drawn or not.

remarks.para: Default value is set to .

member.name: P:Accord.Controls.ManipulatorControl.ResetPositionOnMouseRelease
member.summary: Determines behaviour of manipulator, when mouse button is released.

remarks.para: The property controls behaviour of manipulator on releasing mouse button. If the property is set to , then position of manipulator is reset to (0, 0), when mouse button is released. Otherwise manipulator stays on the place, where it was left.
Default value is set to .

member.summary: Color used for drawing borders and axis's.

remarks.para: Default value is set to .

member.name: T:Accord.Controls.ManipulatorControl.PositionEventArgs
member.summary: Class, which summarizes arguments of manipulator's position change event.

remarks.para:
Properties of this class allow to get:
X/Y coordinates of manipulator in Cartesian coordinate system, where X axis is directed from center of the control to the right and Y axis is directed from center to the top. Both coordinates are measured in [-1, 1] range.
Theta and R coordinates of manipulator in Polar coordinate system.

member.name: P:Accord.Controls.ManipulatorControl.PositionEventArgs.X
member.summary: X coordinate of manipulator, [-1, 1].

member.name: P:Accord.Controls.ManipulatorControl.PositionEventArgs.Y
member.summary: Y coordinate of manipulator, [-1, 1].

member.name: P:Accord.Controls.ManipulatorControl.PositionEventArgs.Theta
member.summary: Theta coordinate of manipulator in Polar coordinate system, [0, 359].

member.name: P:Accord.Controls.ManipulatorControl.PositionEventArgs.R
member.summary: R (radius) coordinate of manipulator in Polar coordinate system, [0, 1].

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: X coordinate of manipulator, [-1, 1].
Y coordinate of manipulator, [-1, 1].

member.name: T:Accord.Controls.PictureBox
member.summary: Picture box control for displaying an image.

remarks.para: This control is inherited from System.Windows.Forms.PictureBox and is aimed to resolve one of its issues - inability to display images with high color depth, like 16 bpp grayscale, 48 bpp and 64 bpp color images. .NET framework does not handle 16 bpp grayscale images at all, throwing exception when user tries to display them. Color images with 48 bpp and 64 bpp are "kind of" supported, but only maximum of 13 bits for each color plane are allowed. Therefore this control is created, which allows to display as 16 bpp grayscale images, as 48 bpp and 64 bpp color images.

para.note: To display high color depth images, the control does internal conversion of them to lower color depth images - 8 bpp grayscale, 24 bpp and 32 bpp color images respectively. In the case source image already has low color depth, it is displayed without any conversions.

member.name: P:Accord.Controls.PictureBox.Image
member.summary: Gets or sets the image that the PictureBox displays.

remarks.para: The property is used to set image to be displayed or to get currently displayed image.

para.note: In the case if source image has high color depth, like 16 bpp grayscale image, 48 bpp or 64 bpp color image, it is converted to lower color depth before displaying - to 8 bpp grayscale, 24 bpp or 32 bpp color image respectively.
During color conversion the original source image is kept unmodified, but internal converted copy is created. The property always returns original source image.

member.name: T:Accord.Controls.VideoSourcePlayer
member.summary: Video source player control.

remarks.para: The control is aimed to play video sources, which implement interface. To start playing a video the property should be initialized first and then method should be called. In the case if user needs to perform some sort of image processing with video frames before they are displayed, the event may be used.
Sample usage:

member.name: P:Accord.Controls.VideoSourcePlayer.AutoSizeControl
member.summary: Auto size control or not.

remarks.para: The property specifies if the control should be autosized or not. If the property is set to , then the control will change its size according to video size and control will change its position automatically to be in the center of parent's control.

para.note: Setting the property to has no effect if property is set to .

member.name: P:Accord.Controls.VideoSourcePlayer.KeepAspectRatio
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the player should keep the aspect ratio of the images being shown.

member.name: P:Accord.Controls.VideoSourcePlayer.BorderColor
member.summary: Control's border color.

remarks.para: Specifies color of the border drawn around video frame.

member.name: P:Accord.Controls.VideoSourcePlayer.VideoSource
member.summary: Video source to play.

remarks.para: The property sets the video source to play. After setting the property the method should be used to start playing the video source.

para.note: Trying to change video source while currently set video source is still playing will generate an exception. Use property to check if current video source is still playing or or and methods to stop current video source.

member.exception: Video source can not be changed while current video source is still running.

member.name: P:Accord.Controls.VideoSourcePlayer.IsRunning
member.summary: State of the current video source.

remarks.para: Current state of the current video source object - running or not.

member.name: T:Accord.Controls.VideoSourcePlayer.NewFrameHandler
member.summary: Delegate to notify about new frame.
member.param: Event sender.
New frame.

member.name: E:Accord.Controls.VideoSourcePlayer.NewFrame
member.summary: New frame event.

remarks.para: The event is fired on each new frame received from video source. The event is fired right after receiving and before displaying, what gives user a chance to perform some image processing on the new frame and/or update it.

para.note: Users should not keep references of the passed to the event handler image. If user needs to keep the image, it should be cloned, since the original image will be disposed by the control when it is required.

member.name: E:Accord.Controls.VideoSourcePlayer.PlayingFinished
member.summary: Playing finished event.

remarks.para: The event is fired when/if video playing finishes. The reason of video stopping is provided as an argument to the event handler.

member.name: M:Accord.Controls.VideoSourcePlayer.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Accord.Controls.VideoSourcePlayer.Start
member.summary: Start video source and displaying its frames.

member.name: M:Accord.Controls.VideoSourcePlayer.Stop
member.summary: Stop video source.

remarks.para: The method stops video source by calling its method, which abourts internal video source's thread. Use and for more polite video source stopping, which gives a chance for video source to perform proper shut down and clean up.

member.name: M:Accord.Controls.VideoSourcePlayer.SignalToStop
member.summary: Signal video source to stop.

remarks.para: Use method to wait until video source stops.

member.name: M:Accord.Controls.VideoSourcePlayer.WaitForStop
member.summary: Wait for video source has stopped.

remarks.para: Waits for video source stopping after it was signaled to stop using method. If was not called, then it will be called automatically.

member.name: M:Accord.Controls.VideoSourcePlayer.GetCurrentVideoFrame
member.summary: Get clone of current video frame displayed by the control.
member.returns: Returns copy of the video frame, which is currently displayed by the control - the last video frame received from video source. If the control did not receive any video frames yet, then the method returns .
